title: Kemben (breast Cloth), 1900–50
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave
description: Two-color batik breast cloth (kemben) or shoulder cloth (selendang) in tan and dark blue on ivory cotton. Field pattern is an all-over square repeat of small rosette blossoms. Narrow band at each end with outer band imitation fringe and outer narrow guard stripes. Cut into narrow length (one side intact) and one face gilded (prada technique): field of square grid enclosing an assortment of full-face blossoms. Narrow border at each side, patterned band and outer plain gold band at each end.

tombstone.epitaph:
Kemben (breast Cloth), 1900–50.Medium: cotton
Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave. 1972-6-1.
